column4: How do I resize my ubuntu HD partition in the command line while in ubuntu?
it's what I'm booted into atm
without unmounting the partition, it won't be possible to resize it
hmm, then I would probably have to use a gutsy liveCD
but how do I go about resizing a partition?
just use gparted, it is include on the livecd
I'm running kubuntu and I only have the kubuntu liveCD, would parted suffice?
there is also an article on how to resize on howtoforge
parted has resize option but it wants a start and end. what would I put there?
wouldn't it just be start=0 and end=X   why would someone need a start? or is that part of the entire disk that start part?
